summary:
This mod allows you change multipliers of damages for each type of game difficulty.

SKSE/SkyUI version.
descriptionHtml:
[color=#ff0000][size=3][b]ATTENTION[/b][/size][/color]

[size=3]Modding for standard Skyrim is no longer supported. The Skyrim SE version of this mod can be found [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/14362]here[/url].[/size]


[color=#9fc5e8][size=3][b]DESCRIPTION[/b][/size][/color]

[size=3]This mod allows you change multipliers of damages for each type of game difficulty. For instance, at the "Legendary" level you will produce a hit with a damage x0.25, while NPCs will hit you with x3 multiplier. Using this mod you are able to fix that.

Features:[/size]
[list]
[*][size=3]Powered by SkyUI (MCM only)[/size]
[*][size=3]No plans to add new features[/size]
[/list]

[color=#9fc5e8][size=3][b]REQUIREMENTS[/b][/size][/color]

[list]
[*][size=3][url=http://skse.silverlock.org/]SKSE 1.6.16[/url] or newer[/size]
[*][size=3][url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/3863]SkyUI 4.1[/url] or newer[/size]
[/list]

[color=#9fc5e8][size=3][b]UPDATING[/b][/size][/color]

[size=3]Just overwrite files and play.[/size]


[color=#9fc5e8][size=3][b]WHY?[/b][/size][/color]

[size=3]You may know others mods with same functionality and I know them too.

My goals were:[/size]

[list]
[*][size=3]Give an ability to change multipliers inside the game without changing order of ".esp" files or choose exactly one type difficulty as author said.[/size]
[*][size=3]Do not add any other things to balance the game. Standalone mod to do one thing :)[/size]
[/list]
[size=3]If you are looking for mod to change multipliers depending on weapon's type or material, or even magick spell type, checkout [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/55597]Weapon Damage UI[/url][/size]


[color=#9fc5e8][size=3][b]CREDITS[/b][/size][/color]

[size=3]The mod is forked version of [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/51988/]Customizable Difficulty[/url] by Leonord.
Sorry man, I can't wait when you release new version. So, I had to rewrite all things.

SKSE-free version [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/4981/]Custom Difficulty[/url] by Phitt:

I've playing with this one all the time, but sometimes I want to change
multipliers inside the game and I could not do this.

Thank you very much, guys![/size]


[color=#9fc5e8][size=3][b]INSTALLATION[/b][/size][/color]

[size=3]For NMM, MO users:[/size]

[list]
[*][size=3]Download, install and activate mod as any other.[/size]
[*][size=3]Follow instructions below from p.3[/size]
[/list]
[size=3]For all:[/size]
[list=1]
[*][size=3]Unpack the contents of the archive to your "Skyrim/Data" folder.[/size]
[*][size=3]Check cdUI.esp file in the mod manager.[/size]
[*][size=3]Run Skyrim via SKSE.[/size]
[*][size=3]Enter to Mod Settings and exit: Esc -> MOD SETTINGS -> TAB -> TAB[/size]
[*][size=3]Wait 5-10 seconds until you receive message "Custom Difficulty UI disabled".[/size]
[*][size=3]Enter to Mod Settings and customize it on your taste.[/size]
[/list]

[color=#9fc5e8][size=3][b]UNINSTALLING[/b][/size][/color]

[list=1]
[*][size=3]In Mod Settings disable mod.[/size]
[*][size=3]Save the game.[/size]
[*][size=3]Disactivate mod in mod manager.[/size]
[*][size=3]Delete files from "Skyrim/Data" folder (for non-NMM/MO users).[/size]
[/list]
author: gh0stwizard

files.name: Custom_Difficulty_UI-1.02-EN-RU
files.changelogHtml: On page "Miscellaneous" added settings to adjust sliders
